  2. Next, stir in about half of the enchilada sauce into the beef mix. This is where the flavor magic happens. Grab your tortillas and spoon some of that beef mixture onto each one, sprinkle a little cheese on top, and roll them up tightly.
  3. Now, place the rolled enchiladas seam-side down in a greased baking dish. Pour the remaining enchilada sauce over the top and sprinkle with the rest of the cheese. Seriously, donâ€™t skimp on the cheese here. Itâ€™s like the crown jewel!
  4. Pop that baking dish in the oven for about 20 minutes. Youâ€™ll know theyâ€™re ready when the cheese is melted and bubbling. I mean, how good does that sound?
  5. Let them cool for a few minutes before serving. And trust me, a dollop of sour cream and some fresh cilantro on top really takes it up a notch!

item.title: Cozy Classic Moist Banana Bread Recipe for Fall Gatherings
item.description: This Classic Moist Banana Bread is the ultimate comfort food! With buttery goodness and optional chocolate chips, it's perfect for chilly evenings or sharing at gatherings. | â±ï¸ Prep: 15min | Cook: 60min | Serves: 12 | #cat1761230594885 #Easyrecipe #recipe #cooking #foodie
item.dc:creator: author_001
item.content:encoded:
â±ï¸ Prep Time: 15 minutes

ğŸ³ Cook Time: 60 minutes

â° Total Time: 75 minutes

ğŸ½ï¸ Servings: 12

ğŸ“Š Difficulty: Easy

ğŸ¥˜ Ingredients

  • 3 ripe bananas, mashed
  • 1/3 cup melted butter
  • 1 teaspoon baking soda
  • Pinch of salt
  • 3/4 cup sugar
  • 1 large egg, beaten
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
  • 1 cup all-purpose flour
  • Optional: 1/2 cup chocolate chips or walnuts

ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ³ Instructions

  1. Preheat your oven to 350Â°F (175Â°C) and grease a 4x8 inch loaf pan.
  2. In a mixing bowl, mash the ripe bananas with a fork until smooth, then mix in the melted butter.
  3. Stir in the baking soda and salt, followed by the sugar, beaten egg, and vanilla extract.
  4. Mix in the flour until just incorporated, being careful not to over-mix. If you're adding chocolate chips or walnuts, fold them in now.
  5. Pour the batter into the prepared loaf pan and smooth the top.
  6. Bake for 60-65 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
  7. Let it cool in the pan for about 10 minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely.

item.description: These honey garlic cocktail meatballs are the ultimate party starter! With a sweet and savory glaze, theyâ€™re perfect for gatherings. Serve them warm with toothpicks for a delightful bite-sized treat! | â±ï¸ Prep: 15min | Cook: 20min | Serves: 6 | #cat1761230749334 #Easyrecipe #1hourmeals #recipe #cooking

item.content:encoded:
â±ï¸ Prep Time: 15 minutes

ğŸ³ Cook Time: 20 minutes

â° Total Time: 35 minutes

ğŸ½ï¸ Servings: 6

ğŸ“Š Difficulty: Easy

ğŸ¥˜ Ingredients

  • 1 pound ground beef
  • 1/2 cup breadcrumbs
  • 1/4 cup grated Parmesan cheese
  • 1 egg, beaten
  • 2 cloves garlic, minced
  • 1/4 cup chopped green onions
  • 1/2 teaspoon salt
  • 1/4 teaspoon black pepper
  • 1/2 cup honey
  • 1/4 cup soy sauce
  • 1 tablespoon apple cider vinegar

ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ³ Instructions

  1. Preheat your oven to 400Â°F (200Â°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
  2. In a large bowl, combine the ground beef, breadcrumbs, Parmesan cheese, beaten egg, minced garlic, green onions, salt, and pepper. Mix until just combined.
  3. Form the mixture into small meatballs, about 1 inch in diameter, and place them on the prepared baking sheet.
  4. Bake the meatballs for 15-20 minutes, or until they are browned and cooked through.
  5. While the meatballs are baking, whisk together honey, soy sauce, and apple cider vinegar in a small saucepan. Heat over medium until it simmers, then reduce the heat and let it thicken slightly.
  6. Once the meatballs are done, toss them in the honey garlic sauce and serve warm with toothpicks.

item.content:encoded:

ğŸ³ Cook Time: 30 minutes

â° Total Time: 45 minutes

ğŸ½ï¸ Servings: 4

ğŸ“Š Difficulty: Easy

ğŸ¥˜ Ingredients

  • 8 oz egg noodles, uncooked
  • 1 lb chicken breast, sliced
  • 3 tbsp soy sauce
  • 2 tbsp honey
  • 4 cloves garlic, minced
  • 1 tbsp vegetable oil
  • 1/2 tsp black pepper
  • 2 green onions, chopped

ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ³ Instructions

  1. Cook the egg noodles according to package instructions. Drain and set aside.
  2. In a large skillet, heat vegetable oil over medium-high heat. Add sliced chicken and season with black pepper.

  4. Add minced garlic, soy sauce, and honey to the skillet. Stir to coat the chicken and cook for another 2-3 minutes until the sauce thickens slightly.
  5. Toss in the cooked noodles and mix until they are well coated in the sauce.
  6. Serve hot, garnished with chopped green onions.

item.title: Hearty Crockpot Beef Stew for Cozy Nights
item.description: This hearty crockpot beef stew is the ultimate comfort meal. Tender beef, soft veggies, and a savory broth simmer together for hours. Perfect for chilly evenings or meal prep! | â±ï¸ Prep: 15min | Cook: 480min | Serves: 6 | #Easyrecipe #recipe #cooking #foodie #homemade
item.dc:creator: author_001
item.content:encoded:
â±ï¸ Prep Time: 15 minutes

ğŸ³ Cook Time: 480 minutes

â° Total Time: 495 minutes

ğŸ½ï¸ Servings: 6

ğŸ“Š Difficulty: Easy

ğŸ¥˜ Ingredients

  • 2 lbs beef chuck, cut into 1-inch cubes
  • 4 medium carrots, sliced
  • 4 medium potatoes, diced
  • 1 onion, chopped
  • 3 cloves garlic, minced
  • 4 cups beef broth
  • 2 tbsp tomato paste
  • 1 tsp dried thyme
  • 1 bay leaf
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • 2 tbsp olive oil

ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ³ Instructions

  1. In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium-high heat. Brown the beef cubes on all sides, about 5-7 minutes.
  2. Transfer the browned beef to the crockpot. Add carrots, potatoes, onion, and garlic on top.
  3. In a bowl, mix the beef broth, tomato paste, thyme, bay leaf, salt, and pepper. Pour this mixture over the ingredients in the crockpot.
  4. Cover and cook on low for 8 hours or on high for 4 hours, until the beef is tender and the vegetables are cooked through.
  5. Before serving, remove the bay leaf and adjust seasoning if needed. Enjoy your cozy stew!

item.description: These Apple Fritter Waffle Donuts are the perfect fall treat. With tart apples and a sweet glaze, they bring cozy vibes to your breakfast table. Enjoy them warm on a crisp autumn morning! | â±ï¸ Prep: 15min | Cook: 20min | Serves: 6 | #cat1761230422512 #Mediumrecipe #1hourmeals #recipe #cooking
item.dc:creator: author_001
item.content:encoded:
â±ï¸ Prep Time: 15 minutes

ğŸ³ Cook Time: 20 minutes

â° Total Time: 35 minutes

ğŸ½ï¸ Servings: 6

ğŸ“Š Difficulty: Medium

ğŸ¥˜ Ingredients

  • 2 cups all-purpose flour
  • 1 tablespoon baking powder
  • 1/2 teaspoon salt
  • 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
  • 1/4 cup granulated sugar
  • 1/2 cup buttermilk
  • 1/4 cup milk
  • 1 large egg
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
  • 1 cup peeled and diced apples (like Granny Smith)
  • 1 cup powdered sugar
  • 2 tablespoons milk (for glaze)

ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ³ Instructions

  1. In a large bowl, whisk together flour, baking powder, salt, cinnamon, and sugar until well combined.

  3. Fold in the diced apples gently, being careful not to overmix.
  4. Preheat your waffle maker and lightly grease it. Pour the batter into the waffle maker, filling it about halfway, and cook until golden brown (about 4-5 minutes).
  5. While the waffles are cooking, whisk together powdered sugar and 2 tablespoons of milk to create a glaze.
  6. Once the waffle donuts are done, drizzle the glaze over them while theyâ€™re still warm. Enjoy!

  1. OK, so first things first, preheat your oven to 325Â°F. While that's heating up, let's prep the turkey. Rinse it under cold water and pat it dry with paper towels. Season it generously with salt, pepper, and smoked paprika.

  3. Flip the turkey and pour in 2 cups of chicken broth. Cover with foil and roast for about 2 hours. Check for doneness; it should reach 165Â°F in the thickest part. Trust me, you want to avoid undercooked turkey.
  4. While the turkey is roasting, heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add the diced onion and sautÃ© until translucent, then throw in the garlic and collard greens. Cook until the greens are wilted, about 10 minutes.
  5. Season the collards with salt and pepper, then add a splash of chicken broth if they seem dry. Let them simmer while the turkey finishes up. And don't forget to whip up that cornbread - easy peasy with Bob's Red Mill cornmeal.

  • 8 ounces elbow macaroni, cooked and drained

  • 1/4 cup all-purpose flour, Bob's Red Mill recommended
  • 1 teaspoon garlic powder
  • 1 teaspoon onion powder
  • Salt and black pepper to taste
  • 1/2 cup breadcrumbs for topping

ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ³ Instructions

  1. Preheat your oven to 350Â°F (175Â°C). While that's happening, grab a large pot and melt the Kerrygold butter over medium heat.
  2. Whisk in the Bob's Red Mill flour to create a roux, stirring for about 2 minutes until itâ€™s bubbling. You want it to be a light golden color, kinda like a tan.
  3. Slowly pour in the milk and heavy cream while whisking continuously. Bring it to a gentle simmer and watch for it to thicken, which takes about 5 minutes.
  4. Stir in 1 1/2 cups of the cheddar cheese along with the garlic powder and onion powder. Keep stirring until everything is melted and creamy. Then, mix in the cooked macaroni and season with salt and pepper.
  5. Transfer the mac and cheese to a greased baking dish. Sprinkle the remaining cheese on top, then add breadcrumbs. Bake for 20-25 minutes until itâ€™s all bubbly and golden on top.
